summary: dashboard can not display correct when clicked the icon second time after launched
description: since dashboard using role dashboard and using qtaglextras
these is a problem happend
dashboard will launched and display first time when you click button in launcher menu
when you switch to another application and try to switch back into dashboard it will not display
because qtaglextras using role to check if dashboard icon is clicked
but the homescreen-service using application name
solution qtaglextras using role and name both to check if this application is clicked
homescreen-service sending role and name with event tapshortcut

for example application_name dashboard application_role dashboard these is a problem that homescreen-service know application role so right now using a static table to get application role to avoid this issus
and in future we want to add a new api named registermyapplication(role that application can using the api to tell homescreen-service role of application

in the current workflow socket file will be deleted if it already exists
however if the socket file is a symbolic link and the file that it refers to exist we will got address already in use because bind thinks the socket file exists and create it
now use lstat to determine whether the socket file exists

summary: phone app contacts not updating from connected pbap device
description: after connecting a pbap capable device in settings phone app no longer displays the contacts from the phone
this was reported on the mailing list for flouder and i also confirmed the issue on
we have noticed that the sound output can be clipped on the board
this only happens with the card the output on an usb sound card is always fine
the issue might be related to process resource limitations with systemd since launching the process on cmdline makes the problem not happen
furthermore removing that line from the service file makes the sound fine

summary: pulseaudio crash when it plays audio to lineout
description: steps connect speaker to lineout of porter exectute following command paplay or aplay default sound card is pulseaudio went to infinite loop and was killed/restarted by systemd automatically
below log was displayed
connection failure connection terminated stream error connection terminated immediately again
playback successfully done without crash
observation when sink is in suspended from pulseaudio point of view it seems to try to resume device and fails retry again and again
this causes infinite loop in pulseaudio
after its restarting sink becomes idle and change to suspend within approx
sec
during idle state pulseaudio can successfully start playback to lineout
as another observation this issue has never happen with bb based kernel
and also it has never been observed without pulseaudio like direct access to alsa device
aplay therefore this issue seems to be occurred by combination with pulseaudio and asoc driver
i had doubt that this issue was caused by the update of asoc driver
hint quite similar issue was reported in debian community
workaround using usb dac by changing kernel config due to default off in renesas kernel and assign this sink to of pulseaudio
change kernel config connect check sound card is detected by pulseaudio pactl list sinks assign detected sink to default pactl sink name
